channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 80-year-old grandmother becomes oldest woman to finish the Ironman World Championship
item.description: Just 20 years ago, Natalie Grabow was learning to swim. Now she's hailed as an inspiration after winning her age group at the famously grueling triath...

item.title: The Small Company in Europe Caught in the Big Trade War Between the U.S. and China
item.description: Nexperia, a computer chip maker headquartered in the Netherlands, was taken over by the Dutch government after pressure from officials in Washington.

item.title: FEMA Cuts Disaster Spending, Leaving States Fending for Themselves
item.description: President Trump has said he wants to eventually shift the burden of disaster relief and recovery onto states. It’s already happening.

item.title: Vatican Panel Says Church Is Still Too Slow in Addressing Sexual Abuse
item.description: The commission’s report highlights the difficulties Pope Leo faces in trying to end clerical abuses and ensure abusers are held to account.

item.title: Some of the things Gaza needs: A government, security and tools to rebuild
item.description: A shaky ceasefire is holding. Now the Palestinian territory is in urgent need of a functioning government, order on the streets, and resources to star...

item.title: Health insurance premiums are going up next year — unless you work at these companies
item.description: As U.S. health insurance costs rise, some companies are paying for all of their workers' premiums. It's a big expense — but they say it pays off.

item.title: India Tiptoes Around Trump’s Latest Claims on Russian Oil Purchases
item.description: The government subtly rebuffed the president’s comments that it would stop buying Russian oil, as it tries to avoid a public fight and end a trade dis...

item.title: Targets of Trump's Justice Department must pay up, even if they win
item.description: For defendants facing criminal charges from the Justice Department, the costs of fighting are enormous and can reverberate for years, according to vet...

item.title: Israel Marks Two Years Since Oct. 7 as a Fragile Cease-Fire in Gaza Holds
item.description: Ceremonies took place on Thursday to commemorate two years since the surprise attack on southern Israel, according to the Jewish calendar.

item.title: Trump escalates pressure on Venezuelan drug trade. And, judge pauses shutdown layoffs
item.description: Trump escalates pressure on Venezuela by authorizing covert CIA operations. And, a federal judge halts the Trump administration's shutdown layoffs.

item.title: France’s Government Narrowly Survives No-Confidence Vote
item.description: The result gives Sébastien Lecornu, France’s prime minister, a reprieve after weeks of political turmoil. But he still has to get a budget passed by t...

item.title: Vatican Panel Says Church Is Still Too Slow in Addressing Sexual Abuse
item.description: The commission’s report highlights the difficulties Pope Leo faces in trying to end clerical abuses and ensure abusers are held to account.

item.title: Israel Marks Two Years Since Oct. 7 as a Fragile Cease-Fire in Gaza Holds
item.description: Ceremonies took place on Thursday to commemorate two years since the surprise attack on southern Israel, according to the Jewish calendar.

item.title: World Meteorological Report Marks Biggest Annual Jump in CO2 Levels
item.description: Surging emissions from wildfires may have been behind the increase, which was the largest since modern measurements began more than half a century ago...

item.title: India Tiptoes Around Trump’s Latest Claims on Russian Oil Purchases
item.description: The government subtly rebuffed the president’s comments that it would stop buying Russian oil, as it tries to avoid a public fight and end a trade dis...
